documents.document: Pleased we won, but i really feel sorry for the guy
Marcus Stoinis - 7 runs short of a knighthood, amirite?
@suzolliver Ameri (that's America without CA, cos these things are always better when you have to explain them)
Didn't get to #lca2017 this year but the team have done a fantastic job of publishing videos & metadata https://t.co/lwlJHRJkrV
@tveastman I'm bad at it too :-)
@dritchie That's nearly 1 Ford Ranger per hour - times must be good down on the farm
@peikk00 @anitsirk that session normally includes some ruby, but didn't have time this year. The actual weather will be more exciting anyway
@puck_ ain't that always the way :-)
@BR3NDA I hope your drains don't go anywhere near them. Had to get the Pohutakawa roots cleared from our sewer line the other week
@tveastman and no doubt that would be life-enhancing too :-)
@tveastman I found my life was improved by a user stylesheet that hides promoted tweets and other crap on twitter
@saniac I can't even imagine the thought processes that would go into doing something like that. Nasty fuckers
A couple of great talks with lessons on team dynamics for software development: https://t.co/uce8NHcSz4 and https://t.co/cZwb81tzxJ
I'm home alone for the first time in ages. I'd probably be enjoying it more if I hadn't had to get up at 4am to take wife to airport
I missed the memo - you can now document your project on GitHub using master:/docs rather than a gh-pages branch https://t.co/KMmILnsRWU
@ned0r @tveastman or is it because all your money is in bitcoin?
Weird thing is I can't recall ever typing 👍 in a tweet or text msg
I resemble that remark! https://t.co/3yxCEgMYqR
@ranginui Still cleaning out that fridge?
@BR3NDA but if anyone wants a low bar to compare themselves to, we treated our Xmas guests to ham & cheese toasted sandwiches
Innovation in action! Mr 19 experiments with transforming Ferrero Rocher into chocolate milk https://t.co/BlyHEncu6b
@BR3NDA these exclusive deals are not consumer-friendly
@nzkoz Gave up on Google Authenticator when I tried to move to a new phone & it nuked everything. Switched to Authy which does xfers better
@tveastman In which case perhaps a bloom filter could tell you that nobody else has the password you just generated
@haquaman works for me
Save our clean, electric trains. Replacing them with old fashion polluting diesel ones is massive backward step. https://t.co/Ybq0Vlgb4E
and it turns out some of the stuff my kids are watching is actually pretty cool
@andychilton I seem to get YouTube suggestions relating to things other people in the house are watching. Check your kids :-) #dadops

@hollowaynz apologies for teaching you to suck eggs :-) Here, have a muppet themed one ...
SPAPIGSCE
@tveastman $ cat naughty_list.txt File "christmas_analysis", line 42 print name ^ SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'
Wellington Perl Monger December social meeting is tonight! https://t.co/zkZa18JEi3
I find it amazing that TIME's web site is still running Vignette StoryServer after all these years https://t.co/fEu5Y3rcGL
@neilbowers @pjf heh me too. I thought "is there another person on the planet whose brain is wired like @pjf's"?
@VikOlliver 46% of Austrians apparently do not
@BR3NDA I routinely have to mispronounce the name of my street if I want to be understood :-(
This morning's project: removing what appears to be a bumble bee nest from under our house. I have angered the bees… https://t.co/3rFf8n6FkK
Womens Sevens Final NZLvsAUS full game: https://t.co/ytQKSyMMmM
@galgonemild @DubiousStephen Have you seen this: https://t.co/Dq4AZHduSt definitely worth a read
Mathematical fun from "Full Frontal Nerdity" https://t.co/hG04pflnC5
This is an excellent initiative https://t.co/5yk9exXKRC - I wonder if it's something Iwi organisations could get behind in NZ
@ranginui looks like he did a great job (also looks a lot like my dinner from Sunday night)
@tveastman you seem to be glossing over three world cup victories in the best sport every invented
@andychilton you and I are now in a state of disputationess about whether "undevelopeable" is a real word.
Not sure how I'm going to get that out of my head
"Oh Canada ... what are they feeding you?"
Daughter is currently singing a mashup of the Canadian national anthem and "Smelly Cat" by Phoebe from Friends. It goes like this ...
Really good talk from Bruno - Things you MUST know before you deploy OpenStack https://t.co/gqoTTgvUNE
Just leaving this here so I remember to watch it later ... https://t.co/Mb6jSalLag
@pjf almost helps Wellington.pm ... https://t.co/htIQKb3d3K
Wikipedia says Nov 8 is election day in the USA. You'd think there would have been some mention of that in the media https://t.co/vn9fbNjE9C
@BR3NDA think of it like a graph. The main centres are vertices, routes between are edges, "regions" are areas enclosed by edges. #maths
As an All Blacks fan I have to say that was a cracking game of rugby and Ireland thoroughly deserved the result #IREvNZL
@mrgreatnews it would probably be accurate to say you literally live on a faultline. No sulphurous emissions thankfully.
@slyall heh, there's a lot of highly unlikely stuff in that tweet, but twitter still being around in 2057 is surely a stretch :-)
Super proud of our Ms 17 who has just been selected as Head Girl of Tawa College for 2017.
A really good talk from Simon Sinek on empathy (and millennials and finding fulfilment) https://t.co/gthxIN5sSa
@danielnashnz it was a good catch-up but if I'd left 2 min earlier I'd have made the train :-)
@OneLouderApps Thanks for the update - I was especially waiting for the longer tweet support.
@ranginui if you don't get endorsement kickbacks from HP then crop out their logo
It's not often I find myself agreeing with David Seymour. Police behaviour was deplorable. https://t.co/AdoSjBk7e8
Pomegranate Kitchen are halfway to their PledgeMe target - can you help them over the line? https://t.co/elINE1kXX5 via @pledgeme
Do I know any Perl devs in Wellington looking for a new challenge? I know someone who wants one.
@VikOlliver might I suggest keeping your own limbs out of the chipper too
Hey @primetv_nz if you screened #BlackFerns games there's a couple of people in my house who'd definitely be watching
This is excellent! https://t.co/F0rETpiENl
@tveastman @wizzyrea also in true Orwellian newspeak fashion it's not "parking enforcement" but "parking services".
Today was the annual #SpringIntoTawa community event, so of course the weather turn cold, wet & windy. Singing & fo… https://t.co/uJfNJMKXIp
@RichardHulse If they threw in "No 'While you were away'", "No 'You might Like'" and "No 'Moments'" I'd pay $2.50!
@BR3NDA I think I was just looking at the JSON file flying by when I viewed the Kapiti train line page on the metlink site
@tveastman as familiar as I am with your trolling ways, I'll have to assume you'd vote for the orange guy in Orange County
@aleishaamohia @ranginui @CatalystAcademy because we're discriminating against non-breathers this year :-)
A really good talk: "Mid-career survival for people who don’t want to be an attrition statistic when they grow up"… https://t.co/ZW5LFF2T7i
Lester wasn't my top pick for Mayor but the Stuff commenters seem to agree his win is a disaster - so I guess he's probably OK.
@adzebill if only you'd created this manifesto before the local body elections!
Fascinating video from a Czech guy resurrecting the "Nixie tube" https://t.co/5iBVhD2VV7
This "Eddie Swish" guy is amazing. He's kind, he's caring and he's working hard to help other people -what an inspiration! #EddieSwish
@tveastman Cryptic. Is it more like G-Spot or G-Tab ?
@ranginui Yes, I get that. It just seems like an odd way for the journalist to refer to her. "His Mother" would seem less odd.
"He's been practising saying hello to people for his big day," Writes said. https://t.co/E8cUsoZkUf I suspect his mum's name is not "Writes"
@puck_ did you try piping through | col -b ?
@saniac good for you, I usually find it's my daughter giving *me* the lecture on procrastination
A few future All Blacks in this lot: https://t.co/vN7DItupgW
Put the last command's run time in your Bash prompt - Jake McCrary - https://t.co/VZ4tnUw6PQ
@saniac The UX people don't care. It's the UI people who have apparently been replaced by robots.
@dritchie I'm with Slingshot and our UFB is much better than ADSL. The WIFI on the supplied router is shit, so we added our own WIFI
The linked piece on the Wellington mayoral race is worth a read. https://t.co/XyILNdjTut
Vaea Fifita combines rugby and hurdling ... https://t.co/bPV09Dhhcu
@chrisjrn thanks for the link - a thoroughly excellent talk from @QEDunham
@github ... and earn some money?
@BR3NDA I think you vastly overestimate the level of engagement and consideration from the average voter.
@andychilton have your server redirect to one of your domains so people see something useful rather than being troll victims
Don't much like generalising about "Kiwi Culture" but there are some gems in this post from @ianapperley https://t.co/CQZgcstAvD
@normnz It is very handy - the documentation suggests it's existed in some form since 2012. More recently added to Chrome I think.

@ranginui Is that Charlie Sheen? It sure looks like him :-)
@jnthnwrthngtn I'm exhausted just reading about it. Thanks for your amazing contributions.

@BR3NDA that's an excellent article, but I made the mistake of peeking into the toxic sludge of the comment section - fucking awful
